verses.kjv: Follow after charity, and desire spiritual gifts, but rather that ye may prophesy.
verses.web: Follow after love and earnestly desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy.
verses.ct: Pursue love above everything else, and eagerly desire spiritual gifts — especially the gift of prophecy.

verses.kjv: For he that speaketh in an unknown tongue speaketh not unto men, but unto God: for no man understandeth him; howbeit in the spirit he speaketh mysteries.
verses.web: For he who speaks in another language speaks not to men, but to God; for no one understands; but in the Spirit he speaks mysteries.
verses.ct: Here's why: when someone speaks in an unknown tongue, they aren't speaking to people — they're speaking to God. No one understands them. In the spirit, they're speaking mysteries.

verses.kjv: But he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification, and exhortation, and comfort.
verses.web: But he who prophesies speaks to men for their edification, exhortation, and consolation.
verses.ct: But the person who prophesies speaks directly to people, building them up, encouraging them, and bringing them comfort.

verses.kjv: He that speaketh in an unknown tongue edifieth himself; but he that prophesieth edifieth the church.
verses.web: He who speaks in another language edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the assembly.
verses.ct: Speaking in an unknown tongue builds up the speaker, but prophesying builds up the whole church.

verses.kjv: I would that ye all spake with tongues, but rather that ye prophesied: for greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive edifying.
verses.web: Now I desire to have you all speak with other languages, but rather that you would prophesy. For he is greater who prophesies than he who speaks with other languages, unless he interprets, that the assembly may be built up.
verses.ct: I wish all of you could speak in tongues, but I'd much rather you prophesied. The person who prophesies does something greater than the one who speaks in tongues — unless that person also interprets what they've said, so the church can be built up.

verses.kjv: Now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation, or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?
verses.web: But now, brothers, if I come to you speaking with other languages, what would I profit you, unless I speak to you either by way of revelation, or of knowledge, or of prophesying, or of teaching?
verses.ct: Think about it, brothers and sisters: if I came to you speaking in tongues, what good would that do you? None — unless I also brought you a revelation, some knowledge, a prophecy, or a teaching you could understand.

verses.kjv: And even things without life giving sound, whether pipe or harp, except they give a distinction in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped?
verses.web: Even things without life, giving a voice, whether pipe or harp, if they didn’t give a distinction in the sounds, how would it be known what is piped or harped?
verses.ct: Consider even lifeless instruments like a flute or a harp. If they don't produce distinct notes, how will anyone recognize the melody being played?

verses.kjv: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself to the battle?
verses.web: For if the trumpet gave an uncertain sound, who would prepare himself for war?
verses.ct: And if a trumpet blasts an unclear signal, who's going to get ready for battle?

verses.kjv: So likewise ye, except ye utter by the tongue words easy to be understood, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye shall speak into the air.
verses.web: So also you, unless you uttered by the tongue words easy to understand, how would it be known what is spoken? For you would be speaking into the air.
verses.ct: It's the same with you. If the words coming out of your mouth aren't easy to understand, how will anyone know what you're saying? You'll just be talking into thin air.

verses.kjv: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of them is without signification.
verses.web: There are, it may be, so many kinds of sounds in the world, and none of them is without meaning.
verses.ct: There are countless languages in the world, and every one of them carries meaning.

verses.kjv: Therefore if I know not the meaning of the voice, I shall be unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh shall be a barbarian unto me.
verses.web: If then I don’t know the meaning of the sound, I would be to him who speaks a foreigner, and he who speaks would be a foreigner to me.
verses.ct: But if I don't understand someone's language, I'm a foreigner to them, and they're a foreigner to me.

verses.kjv: Even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zealous of spiritual gifts, seek that ye may excel to the edifying of the church.
verses.web: So also you, since you are zealous for spiritual gifts, seek that you may abound to the building up of the assembly.
verses.ct: Since you're so eager for spiritual gifts, focus on the ones that build up the church — and strive to overflow with those.

verses.kjv: Wherefore let him that speaketh in an unknown tongue pray that he may interpret.
verses.web: Therefore let him who speaks in another language pray that he may interpret.
verses.ct: So anyone who speaks in an unknown tongue should pray for the ability to interpret what they've said.

verses.kjv: For if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prayeth, but my understanding is unfruitful.
verses.web: For if I pray in another language, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful.
verses.ct: Because if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit is praying, but my mind gets nothing out of it.

verses.kjv: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.
verses.web: What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also.
verses.ct: So what should I do? I'll pray with my spirit, and I'll also pray with my mind. I'll sing with my spirit, and I'll also sing with my mind.

verses.kjv: Else when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that occupieth the room of the unlearned say Amen at thy giving of thanks, seeing he understandeth not what thou sayest?
verses.web: Otherwise if you bless with the spirit, how will he who fills the place of the unlearned say the “Amen” at your giving of thanks, seeing he doesn’t know what you say?
verses.ct: Otherwise, if you're praising God only in the spirit, how can an outsider who doesn't understand say "Amen" to your prayer of thanks? They have no idea what you just said.

verses.kjv: For thou verily givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.
verses.web: For you most certainly give thanks well, but the other person is not built up.
verses.ct: You might be giving a beautiful prayer of thanks, but the other person isn't being built up by it at all.

verses.kjv: I thank my God, I speak with tongues more than ye all:
verses.web: I thank my God, I speak with other languages more than you all.
verses.ct: I thank God that I speak in tongues more than any of you.

verses.kjv: Yet in the church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that by my voice I might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue.
verses.web: However in the assembly I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that I might instruct others also, than ten thousand words in another language.
verses.ct: But in a church gathering, I'd rather speak 5 words that people can understand — so I can actually teach them something — than 10,000 words in an unknown tongue.

verses.kjv: Brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malice be ye children, but in understanding be men.
verses.web: Brothers, don’t be children in thoughts, yet in malice be babies, but in thoughts be mature.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, stop thinking like children about this. When it comes to evil, be as innocent as babies — but in your thinking, be mature adults.

verses.kjv: In the law it is written, With men of other tongues and other lips will I speak unto this people; and yet for all that will they not hear me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: In the law it is written, “By men of strange languages and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people. They won’t even hear me that way, says the Lord.”
verses.ct: It's written in the Law: "Through people speaking foreign languages and through the lips of strangers I will speak to this people, and even then they won't listen to me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Wherefore tongues are for a sign, not to them that believe, but to them that believe not: but prophesying serveth not for them that believe not, but for them which believe.
verses.web: Therefore other languages are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to the unbelieving; but prophesying is for a sign, not to the unbelieving, but to those who believe.
verses.ct: So tongues serve as a sign not for believers, but for unbelievers. Prophecy, on the other hand, is a sign not for unbelievers, but for believers.

verses.kjv: If therefore the whole church be come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in those that are unlearned, or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?
verses.web: If therefore the whole assembly is assembled together and all speak with other languages, and unlearned or unbelieving people come in, won’t they say that you are crazy?
verses.ct: Picture this: the whole church gathers together and everyone starts speaking in tongues. If outsiders or people who don't understand walk in, won't they think you've all lost your minds?

verses.kjv: But if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not, or one unlearned, he is convinced of all, he is judged of all:
verses.web: But if all prophesy, and someone unbelieving or unlearned comes in, he is reproved by all, and he is judged by all.
verses.ct: But if everyone is prophesying and an unbeliever or outsider walks in, they'll be convicted by what they hear. Every word will pierce their conscience.

verses.kjv: And thus are the secrets of his heart made manifest; and so falling down on his face he will worship God, and report that God is in you of a truth.
verses.web: And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed. So he will fall down on his face and worship God, declaring that God is among you indeed.
verses.ct: The hidden things in their heart will be exposed. They'll fall facedown and worship God, declaring, "God is truly here among you!"

verses.kjv: How is it then, brethren? when ye come together, every one of you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation, hath an interpretation. Let all things be done unto edifying.
verses.web: What is it then, brothers? When you come together, each one of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has another language, or has an interpretation. Let all things be done to build each other up.
verses.ct: So here's the point, brothers and sisters: when you gather together, one person has a psalm, another has a teaching, another has a revelation, another has a message in tongues, and another has an interpretation. Everything you do should build each other up.

verses.kjv: If any man speak in an unknown tongue, let it be by two, or at the most by three, and that by course; and let one interpret.
verses.web: If any man speaks in another language, let it be two, or at the most three, and in turn; and let one interpret.
verses.ct: If anyone speaks in a tongue, limit it to 2 or at most 3 people, and they should take turns. Someone must interpret.

verses.kjv: But if there be no interpreter, let him keep silence in the church; and let him speak to himself, and to God.
verses.web: But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in the assembly, and let him speak to himself, and to God.
verses.ct: If no interpreter is present, the tongue-speaker should stay silent in the church and speak only to themselves and to God.

verses.kjv: Let the prophets speak two or three, and let the other judge.
verses.web: Let the prophets speak, two or three, and let the others discern.
verses.ct: Let 2 or 3 prophets speak, and let the others carefully evaluate what is said.

verses.kjv: If any thing be revealed to another that sitteth by, let the first hold his peace.
verses.web: But if a revelation is made to another sitting by, let the first keep silent.
verses.ct: If someone else sitting there receives a revelation, the first speaker should stop and let them share.

verses.kjv: For ye may all prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be comforted.
verses.web: For you all can prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be exhorted.
verses.ct: You can all prophesy one at a time, so that everyone learns and everyone is encouraged.

verses.kjv: And the spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets.
verses.web: The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets,
verses.ct: The spirits of prophets are under the prophets' own control.

verses.kjv: For God is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as in all churches of the saints.
verses.web: for God is not a God of confusion, but of peace, as in all the assemblies of the saints.
verses.ct: God is not a God of chaos but of peace — and that's how it should be in every church of the saints.

verses.kjv: Let your women keep silence in the churches: for it is not permitted unto them to speak; but they are commanded to be under obedience, as also saith the law.
verses.web: Let the wives be quiet in the assemblies, for it has not been permitted for them to be talking except in submission, as the law also says,
verses.ct: Women should remain silent in the churches. They aren't permitted to speak but should be in submission, as the Law also says.

verses.kjv: And if they will learn any thing, let them ask their husbands at home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.
verses.web: if they desire to learn anything. “Let them ask their own husbands at home, for it is shameful for a wife to be talking in the assembly.”
verses.ct: If they want to learn about something, they should ask their own husbands at home. It's considered shameful for a woman to speak in the church.

verses.kjv: What? came the word of God out from you? or came it unto you only?
verses.web: What!? Was it from you that the word of God went out? Or did it come to you alone?
verses.ct: What! Did the word of God originate with you? Or are you the only ones it reached?

verses.kjv: If any man think himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him acknowledge that the things that I write unto you are the commandments of the Lord.
verses.web: If any man thinks himself to be a prophet, or spiritual, let him recognize the things which I write to you, that they are the commandment of the Lord.
verses.ct: If anyone considers themselves a prophet or spiritually gifted, they should recognize that what I'm writing to you is a commandment from the Lord.

verses.kjv: But if any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.
verses.web: But if anyone is ignorant, let him be ignorant.
verses.ct: If anyone chooses to ignore this, let them be ignored.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, brethren, covet to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues.
verses.web: Therefore, brothers, desire earnestly to prophesy, and don’t forbid speaking with other languages.
verses.ct: So, brothers and sisters, eagerly desire the gift of prophecy, and don't forbid speaking in tongues.

verses.kjv: Let all things be done decently and in order.
verses.web: Let all things be done decently and in order.
verses.ct: But make sure everything is done properly and in an orderly way.
